alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 01 at 2:49AM PST until January 01 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Surf of 4 to 7 feet will continue through this morning on west facing beaches. Strong and dangerous rip currents will continue. As surf and tide levels gradually diminish, the threat of coastal flooding has diminished. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Another round of high surf and dangerous rip currents is expected to return to the Ventura coast Wednesday through Thursday, when breakers of 8 to 12 feet will be possible on west facing beaches.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
